Package openconnector.oauth.jwt

Class AbstractJwtClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.oauth.jwt.AbstractJwtClient
  • public abstract class AbstractJwtClient
extends java.lang.Object
    AbstractJwtClient provides an abstraction for different JWT implementations to implement. It deals with the common JWT artifacts viz. client Id, client secret, access and refresh tokens, handling of private key.

    authenticate() is a template method which defines the mechanism to obtain the JWT and related information which internally invokes executeRequest() followed by extractTokenInfo(Object).

    Therefore, it is required to implement following methods for overriding the expected behavior according to the target system:

    • #constructJWTAssertion(): To construct a JWT assertion string.
    • #prepareAuthParameters(): To prepare the request data information for generation of access token.
    • executeRequest(): To execute the HTTP request for generating an access token
    • extractTokenInfo(Object): To extract the token related information - access token, expires in (milliseconds), last refresh (time in milliseconds)
    • #prepareRefreshParameters(): To prepare the request data information for regeneration of refresh as well as access token, if supported by the target system.

      • getAlgorithmIdentifier

        protected java.lang.String getAlgorithmIdentifier()
        Returns the algorithm identifier string for decryption of private key.

        Currently supported algorithms are:

        • SHA-256 with RSA - Default
        • SHA-384 with RSA
        • SHA-512 with RSA
        Returns:
        encryption algorithm identifier string

      • getAccessToken

        public final java.lang.String getAccessToken()
        Returns an access token.

        Before returning an access token, determines whether the access token is valid or needs regeneration using canRefresh() and needsRefresh(). If yes, then refresh() is invoked for regenerating the access token.

        Returns:

      • getAccessToken

        public final java.lang.String getAccessToken​(java.lang.String payload,
                                             java.util.List<org.apache.http.Header> headers)
                                      throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Returns an access token.

        Before returning an access token, determines whether the access token is valid or needs regeneration using canRefresh() and needsRefresh(). If yes, then refresh() is invoked for regenerating the access token.

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • canRefresh

        public boolean canRefresh()
        Checks whether an access token can be refreshed. Default implementation always returns true. If the target system does not support access token refresh, this method can be overridden by the subclass to achieve the desired behavior.
        Returns:
        true if access token refresh is supported, false otherwise.

      • needsRefresh

        protected boolean needsRefresh()
        Checks whether the access token requires to be regenerated. This method can be overridden by the implementing classes to achieve the desired behavior.

        Default implementation always returns true. Subclasses can override and determine when a refresh is required and return true or false accordingly.

        Returns:
        true if the access token has to be regenerated, false otherwise.

      • authenticate

        public final void authenticate()
        Template method defining the process of generating JWT information.

        Requires overriding of executeRequest() and extractTokenInfo(Object) methods.

        public void refresh()
        Refresh JWT using refresh token.

      • serialize

        public final java.lang.String serialize()
        Prepares a JSON representation of the JWT information.

        Format of the JSON representation is: {"accessTokenTtl":EXPIRY_IN_MILLISECONDS ,"lastRefreshed":TIME_IN_MILLISECONDS,"accessToken":"ACCESS_TOKEN"}

        Returns:
        JSON representation of JWT

      • deserialize

        public final void deserialize​(java.lang.String tokenInfoJson)
        Reinitializes the JWT client with an existing JWT information. Refer to serialize() for the expected JSON representation.
        Parameters:
        tokenInfoJson - JSON string containing the JWT information

      • executeRequest

        protected abstract java.lang.Object executeRequest()
        Prepares JWT assertion using JWT claims and executes the token request.
        Returns:
        an object containing JWT related information
